Week of May 4, 2015 <http://www.cfsummit.com/> LAST CHANCE TO JOIN THE CLOUD FOUNDRY COMMUNITY AT CF SUMMIT NEXT WEEK In just a few days, more than 1,500 application developers, IT operations experts, business leaders, service providers and project contributors will gather in Santa Clara for the 3rd annual Cloud Foundry Summit <http://www.cfsummit.com>.
Whether you're a Cloud Foundry expert or just getting started, the Cloud Foundry Summit has something for you. You'll hear success stories from organizations like Comcast, CoreLogic, EMC, Garmin, GE, Kroger, and Verizon, among others and learn everything you need to contribute to the project, deploy software services, operate the platform, and transform your business.
If you haven't registered yet, don't worry - there's still time! Register here <http://www.cfsummit.com/attend> today and we hope to see you in Santa Clara next week! REGISTER <http://www.cfsummit.com> "THINKING ABOUT MOBILE AND HOW IT CHANGES WHAT YOU DO" <http://pivotal.io/podcasts> Join us this week for our latest episode of our All Things Pivotal Podcast Series, "Thinking About Mobile and How it Changes What You Do".
This week, Simon is joined by Farhan Thawar, VP of Engineering at Pivotal Labs Toronto, who brings a rich, real-world perspective to mobile app development and what it takes to do it successfully. SUBSCRIBE <http://blog.pivotal.io/podcasts-pivotal> THIS MONTH IN DATA SCIENCE - APRIL, 2015 <http://blog.pivotal.io/data-science-pivotal/features/this-month-in-data-science-april-2015> The impact of data science and big data technologies was felt far and wide in May, with applications ranging from determining the latest fashions, to sensor-connected lighting, and even to entirely new forms of food. Here’s our roundup of the biggest data science news of the month, both from within Pivotal and beyond.
READ MORE… <http://blog.pivotal.io/data-science-pivotal/features/this-month-in-data-science-april-2015> PIVOTAL HAWQ LANDS IN THE HORTONWORKS SANDBOX <http://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/p-o-v/pivotal-hawq-lands-in-the-hortonworks-sandbox> When Pivotal first announced HAWQ would be available on HDP, some of my first thoughts were about how nice it would be to provide customers the ability to install HAWQ directly onto the Hortonworks Sandbox to provide them with a place to take the software for a spin. This post includes a step-by-step guide for installation for HAWQ on Hortonworks Sandbox.
